results.title: Coping with exam anxiety
results.brief_description: A discussion about the ways in which anxiety and stress before exams, coupled with poor study techniques can adversely affect exams results. Demonstrates a number of techniques for the control of anxiety which will enable students to achieve peak examination performance.
results.description: A discussion about the ways in which anxiety and stress before exams, coupled with poor study techniques can adversely affect exams results. Demonstrates a number of techniques for the control of anxiety which will enable students to achieve peak examination performance.

results.title: Coping with death
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Nurses”.
Nurses “was filmed by four nurses and their friends at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne to capture the real life drama of nursing from a very different perspective…their own” Nurses are: Kerryn O’Rourke - Oncology. Trish Builic - Psychiatric (to the homeless). Jane Newham - Emergency. Cassie Steward - Theatre. Ep 3: This episode examines the kind of thoughts and coping mechanisms the nurses have developed in a job that obviously has a high mortality rate. And in particular reflects upon the naivete of the ‘I am going to be a nurse to help people’ idea that all four women have had to deal with. This episode elaborates upon a patient relationship that we have already seen Kerryn commit to. She talks about the way she has necessarily become more detached and that some days, especially with staff shortages the physical side of nursing of observing patients and administering medication means that you just don’t have the ability to feel sad. And that the flip side to this is that ultimately patients appreciate the kindness, understanding and sensitivity given by nurses not if they got their medication on time. Trish talks about the sense of emotions being at either end of the spectrum, that when someone commits suicide or an assault occurs it’s a big jolt in reminding her how crucial the job is. Jane talks about the ‘controlled voice’ she finds herself using when something really serious is happening.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Coping with deafness
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Richard Dobson
results.brief_description: Bob, Maree and Sadie have hearing impairment. They have illustrated, by means of their own simple sketches, how deafness has affected their lives and how they cope with their disability. Interviewer: Pat Pengilley.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Richard Dobson

results.title: Coping with conflict
results.creator_credit: David Evans, Millbank Films and Ron Tanner
results.brief_description: A conflict situation is dramatised within a small textile finishing works. Steps taken to resolving it are shown. A fruitful discussion starter, it presents lessons from the conflicts in the film to the audience and additional skills learned along the way.

results.title: Coping (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
This is part of series designed for use by upper secondary students and school leavers. The transition from being a student to a working young adult seeking independence can be fraught with unexpected responsibilities and financial problems. This program describes what to expect once you begin working, together with hints on basic survival techniques and personal budgeting.

results.title: Coping - Full of Life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
This program aims to teach young people the mechanisms for coping. Through this program we learn that fun for fun’s sake is an important part of life, that it is important to establish a list of priorities and accept that some things cannot be done, and that it often helps to talk about our problems with someone. Rated: G

results.title: Copenhagen holiday [edited version]
results.brief_description: A film whose feature is the Bing and Grohndahl Porcelain Potteries in Copenhagen. Shows the beautiful ceramic figures being made and hand-painted. The sung narration adds an unusual slant to the film. (Note this is an edited version of “Copenhagen holiday”, Title Code 002410).
